author: pburba
msg: Disable use of unsupported fopen() mode "t" on OS400.
Note: This fopen() call no longer exists in trunk so this patch is
obviously not part of the V5R4 series of trunk patches.

author: pburba
msg: This is one of several patches to allow Subversion to run on IBM's
OS400 V5R4.  It provides a workaround for various limitations with

author: pburba
msg: Disable call to apr_file_putc() until IBM fixes apr_temp_dir_get().
apr_temp_dir_get() is broken on V5R4.  IBM is working on a PTF to fix
it.  The current workaround for apr_temp_dir_get() calls apr_file_putc(),
which, you guessed it, is also broken on V5R4!  This patch holds things
together while we wait on the PTF.  Needless to say this is not a patch
that we'll attempt to get into trunk.

author: pburba
msg: Disable calls to apr_env_get() until IBM fixes it.
This function is broken in two different ways in V5R4 depending on
the PTFs applied.  They are working on a PTF to fix this so this isn't
a patch that we'll attempt to get into trunk.
Change implementations to avoid calls to apr_env_get().
